sub_title: Director Global Access Value Economics @ Intuitive
summary:
Richard is a strategic global Market Access and Government Affairs Policy expert with 14years of experience in medical innovation including artificial hearts, robotic surgery and reimbursement consultancy. Richard combines differentiated strategies to gain Clinical and Payers endorsement necessary to support negotiations with  key decision makers such as national and regional public authorities, payers, providers, medical societies and HTA bodies.

Currently, Global Market Access Director at Intuitive Surgical, robotic surgery. In parallel, he volunteers as the Head of Government Affairs and Health Innovation at the EU Academy of the Regions, aimed at awareness raising to attract funds to establish consortia to improve patient access to medical Technology.

Richard has a solid experience in reimbursement systems across the globe, the evaluation of pre and post launching strategies of emerging and existing technologies, the development of  differentiated value proposition for each relevant stakeholders and  the implementation of hands-on  market access strategies to effectively combine top-down and bottom-up level approached.

Richard has the right combination of analytical and networking skills which has led to the creation of a valuable network with consultants, HTAs and reimbursement decision makers in key countries that facilitates early engagement and product awareness.

Richard is also responsible for the organization and coordination of KOLs in key reimbursement and health policy conferences in Europe.

Richard  holds an executive degree from Wharton, a BSc & MSc degrees in Business Econ & Health Economics Erasmus School of Economics and LEVEL I, II, III and master degree in Reiki (Usui Method)

profile_positions.title: 🌐 Director Global Reimbursement, Market Access, HE & Government Affairs

profile_positions.description:
Ensure patient access to Mechanical Circulatory Support (MCS/VADs) and Funding allocation.
Working closely with Medtronic local reimbursement units to identify key drivers to improve funds for implant and patient set, follow up care, VBHC models for risk sharing structures after patient discharge as well as coverage for patient set replacements.

Organizing EU and local government policy events with the goal of creating awareness about this life saving therapy to guarantee homogeneous access to ventricular assist devices across EU member countries. Dealing with key topics from Quality of Life and Patient Follow up aspects to coverage and reimbursement hurdles that need to be overcome by centers performing this interesting therapy.

Working closely and endorsed by  key medical societies such as EACTS, HFA-ESC, ISHLT, UEMS, ESOT as well as local entities such as SITO and the Spanish Society of Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery. National foundations like “Fundación Cirugía y Corazón”. I create unique platform to bring therapies to next level with the participation of KOLs who daily fight to improve access to those patients in need.

I am strongly supported by the European Academy of the regions on initiaves that are in line with innovations that improve patients quality of live, reduce mortality and adverse events and save patients lives.

I encourage Healthcare decisions makers  to become part of the discussions that lead to sustainable changes in the future of MedTech

He worked closely with HeartWare?Medtronic European Directors, Regional Sales Managers and International Marketing directors in building strategies for his team to support the field force and organizations efforts in overcoming reimbursement challenges. This task involves the coordination of relevant topics regarding reimbursement for the mentioned markets, continuous meetings with the health authorities, HTA agencies & bodies involved in the reimbursement and market access process. 

Knowledge and value creation.  
 Others:
Reimbursement research and therapy development (alternative to sales Rep).

volunteer_experiences.description:
Following the decision of the Board on 16 February 2016, a healthcare department has been set up within EAR/AER under the lead of Mr. Richard Murrugarra-Centurion, European & Emerging Markets Director at HeartWare Inc.

One of the primary areas of activities would be to promote advancements in healthcare Policy, such as the ventricular assist devices (VADs) in support of patients with heart failure.

The new department is aimed at awareness raising, attracting EU funding and establishing consortia, in order to contribute to building the infrastructure and expertise required at regional level.
